p: The effects of future climate change on public health are an active and growing area of research, including the direct impacts of more severe heat waves ( 1, 2) and decreased food security ( 3, 4) to less direct effects on the prevalence of infectious disease ( 5) and air pollution ( 6). In China, where more than 1 million people now die prematurely every year because of air pollution and where the frequency of extreme events and poor weather conditions is expected to increase under climate change ( 7 â€“ 9), the possibility that climate change will exacerbate an already serious problem is especially concerning.
